item.title: Yes, there’s an affordability problem. What else is new?
item.description: Is it a crisis if it has always been the case in America?

item.title: Texas and Florida are right to push the ABA out of legal education oversight
item.description: The changes, if done right, could help expand access to legal services.

item.title: Trump is addicted to military force. But the U.S. needs more soft power.
item.description: It isn’t clear what the U.S. military could do to aid Iranian protesters. And VOA has been eviscerated.

item.title: How Western donors unwittingly support Hamas’s terrorism
item.description: One reliable source of revenue for the terrorist group is money funneled through sham charities.

item.title: The White House kept flexing its ICE power. Now Americans are recoiling.
item.description: The shooting of Renée Good in Minneapolis may mark a turning point in public opinion.

item.title: Trump was right about price controls, until he embraced them
item.description: Capping credit card interest rate won’t help borrowers in trouble. They won’t get credit cards at all.

item.title: It must be nice to be a leftist
item.description: Cea Weaver, Zohran Mamdani, PBS and FDR, in readers’ eyes.

item.title: Launching another trade war with Europe won’t win Greenland
item.description: Tariffs aimed at coercing Denmark into selling the island will make America poorer.

item.title: A supersonic tax hike
item.description: Seattle would have America’s highest top marginal rate if a Washington millionaire’s tax passes.

item.title: Trump’s Greenland threats send a visceral shock through Europe
item.description: U.S. tariffs against eight European nations will start Feb. 1 unless the president’s demands are met.

item.title: What comes after ‘seeing is believing’
item.description: In the age of AI, photographs no longer express truth. That doesn’t make them any less meaningful.

item.title: Trump tests a cunning workaround on executive power
item.description: Does using force outside U.S. borders legitimize claiming emergency power within them?

item.title: North Korea is a nuclear power. Trump’s omission is an admission.
item.description: It’s time to start talking realistically about limiting the size and range of Pyongyang’s arsenal.

item.title: Law and order is a two-way street
item.description: Sanctuary policies create an easy excuse for ICE to go into communities.

item.title: The Gaza peace deal risks being buried in the sands of mistrust
item.description: So long as Hamas refuses to disarm, Israel cannot withdraw.

item.title: The gaping hole in the transgender sports case
item.description: Avoiding the definition of a woman is hurting the trans rights movement.
